content.description: <math alttext="The figure shows a 5 column table with 1 row of data. The data are as follows. x is 2; f of x is negative 1; g of x is negative 4; f prime of x is 5; and g prime of x is 3." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mi>g</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
content.question: The table shown gives values of functions <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="g prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="h of x equals, the fraction f of x, over g of x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="h prime of 2 equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 23 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction 17 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction 11 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 17 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
